_header: Christ made to man a fair present / His bloody body with love I-brent
Subjects: Christ, love of; Christ, sufferings of
_description: A song of the Love of Christ — 44 lines mostly in 4-line stanzas but also couplets, six-line monorhyming stanzas, and six-line stanzas rhyming aabaab

CamTCC353.First Lines:
Crist made to man a fair presenthis blody body wiþ loue
                    ybrentThat blisful body his lyf haþ sentffor loue of man whom
                    synne haþ blent…
CamTCC353.Last Lines:
…Thanne shal my loue be trewe & fynAnd loue in loue shal
                    make fyn
CamTCC353.Note: Written by the same hand as 2459.
CamTCC353.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.166-7.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 235-7.

GULHun512.First Lines:
Crist makiþ to man a fair presentHis blody body wiþ loue
                    brent…
GULHun512.Last Lines:
…Þanne schulde myn be trewe al tymAnd loue in loue schal
                    make it fyn
GULHun512.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.

Davies,  Reginald Thorne. 
             Medieval English Lyrics: a critical anthology.
         London, 1963; Evanston, IL: Northwestern UP, 1964: 139-41.
